contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=March 2007}} Poets who wrote, or write, much or all of their '''[[poetry]] in the [[Yiddish language]]''' include: ==A== * <!-- Altman --> [[Moyshe Altman]] ==B== * <!-- Baumvoll --> [[Rachel Baumvoll]] * <!-- Beyderman --> [[Olexander Beyderman]] * <!-- Bercovici --> [[Israil Bercovici]] * <!-- Bialik --> [[Hayim Nahman Bialik]] * <!-- Broderzon --> [[Moishe Broderzon]] * [[Srul Bronshtein]] ==C== ==D== * <!-- Dropkin --> [[Celia Dropkin]] ==E== * <!-- Edelstadt --> [[David Edelstadt]] * <!-- Israel Emiot --> [[Israel Emiot]]<ref name=boy67>''Britannica Book of the Year 1967'', 1967 (for events of 1966), "Literature" section, "Jewish" subsection, "Yiddish" sub-subsection, page 493</ref> * <!-- Esselin --> [[Alter Esselin]]<ref>Liptzin, Sol, A History of Yiddish Literature, Jonathan David Publishers, Middle Village, NY, 1972, ISBN 0-8246-0124-6, pp.352-353.</ref> ==F== * <!-- Feffer --> [[Itzik Fefer]] * <!-- Felsenbaum --> [[Mikhoel Felsenbaum]] ==G== * <!-- Gebirtig --> [[Mordechai Gebirtig]] * <!-- Glantz-Leieles --> [[Aron Glantz-Leieles]], alternative English spelling: [[Glanz-Leyeles]] ([[1899 in poetry|1899]]–[[1968 in poetry|1968]]), Polish native and Yiddish poet writing in the United States<ref name=nk>Kravitz, Nathaniel, "3,000 Years of Hebrew Literature", Chicago: Swallow Press Inc., 1972, Appendix B ("Other Hebrew Writers and Scholars"), pp 555-559</ref> * <!-- Glatstein --> [[Jacob Glatstein]] (alternative English spelling: [[Yankev Glatshteyn]])<ref name=boy67/> * <!-- Glick --> [[Hirsh Glick]] * <!-- Goldfaden --> [[Abraham Goldfaden]] * <!-- Grade --> [[Chaim Grade]] * <!-- Greenberg --> [[Uri Zvi Greenberg]] ==H== * <!-- Halpern --> [[Moyshe-Leyb Halpern]] * <!-- Heller --> [[Binem Heller]] * <!-- Hofstein --> [[David Hofstein]] ==K== * <!-- Katzenelson --> [[Itzhak Katzenelson]] * <!-- Kazakevitsh --> [[Emmanuil Kazakevich]] * <!-- Kulbak --> [[Moyshe Kulbak]] * <!-- Kvitko --> [[Leib Kvitko]] ==L== * <!-- Leivick --> [[H. Leivick]] ([[1888 in poetry|1888]]-[[1962 in poetry]]), born in Russia, emigrated to the United States; called "foremost" Yiddish poet and dramatist<ref name=nk/> * <!-- Mani Leib --> [[Mani Leib]] * [[Abraham Lyessin]] ([[1872 in poetry|1872]]-[[1948 in poetry|1948]]), American<ref name=nk/> ==M== * <!-- Manger --> [[Itzik Manger]] * <!-- Margolin --> [[Anna Margolin]] * <!-- Markish --> [[Peretz Markish]] ==N== ==O== ==P== * <!-- Preil --> [[Gabriel Preil]] (alternative English spelling: "Gabriel Preyl") <ref name=boy67/> ==R== * <!-- Reisen --> [[Avrom Reyzen]] (Abraham Reisen) * <!-- Regelson --> [[Abraham Regelson]] * <!-- Rosenfarb --> [[Khava Rosenfarb]]<ref name=boy67/> * <!-- Rosenfeld --> [[Morris Rosenfeld]] ==S== * <!-- Schaechter --> [[Beyle Schaechter-Gottesman]] * <!-- Schaechter --> [[Gitl Schaechter-Viswanath]] * <!-- Meyer Shtiker --> [[Meyer Shtiker]]<ref name=boy67/> * <!-- Stencl --> [[Abraham Nahum Stencl]] * <!-- Sternberg --> [[Jacob Sternberg]] * <!-- Sutzkever --> [[Abraham Sutzkever]] ==T== ==V== * <!-- Vaserman --> [[Leyb Vaserman]]<ref name=boy67/> ==W== * <!-- Winchevsky --> [[Morris Winchevsky]] ==Y== * <!-- Yehoash --> [[Yehoash (Blumgarten)]] ==Z== * <!-- Zeitlin --> [[Aaron Zeitlin]] * <!-- Zychlinsky --> [[Rajzel Żychlińsky]] {{Lists of poets}} ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Lists of poets by language|Yiddish]] [[Category:Yiddish-language poets| ]] [[Category:Yiddish literature|Poets]] [[Category:Jewish poets| ]]
